Data.event_text: Ethiopia announces an agreement with Somaliland to use 20 kilometers of coastline, including the port of Berbera, in exchange for eventual recognition of the Somaliland Declaration of Independence, which would make it the first country to do so.

links.text: -"Somalia calls Ethiopia-Somaliland agreement act of aggression". 2024-01-02. Retrieved 2024-01-02.-

Data.event_text: Ethiopia formally joins the BRICS group.

links.text: -"Iran joins BRICS group formally in 2024". Tehran Times. 2024-01-01. Retrieved 2024-01-02.-

Data.event_text: 23 February  An airstrike kills at least 15 people and wounds over 20 more in North Shewa. Many of the victims were fleeing clashes between Fano and the Ethiopian government.

links.text: -"Airstrike in Ethiopia's Amhara kills about 15 civilians, residents say". The East African. 2024-02-23. Retrieved 2024-02-23.-

Data.event_text: 1 March  Heavy fighting between the Fano militia and the federal government breaks out in Bahir Dar, the capital of Amhara Region.

links.text: -"Fighting returns to Amhara region's main city Bahir Dar". The East African. 2024-03-01. Retrieved 2024-03-02.-

Data.event_text: 15 March  The Commercial Bank of Ethiopia (CBE) encounters a systematic glitch on its service involving the withdrawal of more than 40 million dollars. CBE officials suspect that the glitch was caused by economic and political reasons and the money was easily transferred to students in Dilla and Jimma University.

links.text: -"CBE reports massive cyber-attack attempts amid internal "glitch" causing loss of millions of birr". Addis Standard. 2024-03-19. Retrieved 2024-03-20.-
-"Commercial Bank of Ethiopia glitch lets customers withdraw millions". 2024-03-18. Retrieved 2024-03-20.-

Data.event_text: 10 April — Bate Urgessa, a prominent OLF politician and critic of Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed, is found shot dead in Meki, East Shewa Zone in Oromia Region, leading to the arrest of 13 suspects and causing public outrage and international demands for an investigation.

links.text: -"US Senator calls for impartial Investigation into killing of Ethiopian opposition OLF political officer Bate Urgessa". Addis Standard. 2024-04-11. Retrieved 2024-04-13.-

Data.event_text: 12 April — A shootout in Addis Ababa between security forces and Fano members near Millennium Hall leaves one civilian and two Fano members dead and injures two police officers. The police claim the group was intercepted while planning a terrorist attack, with one member killed, another injured and arrested, and the leader fatally wounded.

links.text: -"City police say three killed, two injured during shootout with "extremist Fano" members in Addis Abeba". Addis Standard. 2024-04-12. Retrieved 2024-04-12.-

Data.event_text: 24 April — Seven people are killed after a building collapses on a nearby house in Addis Ababa.

links.text: -"Building collapse kills 7 in Ethiopian capital". Africanews. 2024-04-25. Retrieved 2024-04-25.-

Data.event_text: 9 July   Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed meets in Port Sudan with Sudanese Transitional Sovereignty Council leader and armed forces commander Abdel Fattah al-Burhan to seek an end to the Sudanese Civil War.

links.text: -"Ethiopia's PM Ahmed visits Sudan, discusses peace with Burhan". Sudan Tribune. 2024-07-10. Retrieved 2024-07-10.-

Data.event_text: 17 July   Nine police officers are killed in an attack on a police station near the Kumer refugee camp in Amhara Region.

links.text: -"Ethiopia: Nine policemen dead in attack near camp with Sudanese refugees". Radio Dabanga. 2024-07-18. Retrieved 2024-07-19.-

Data.event_text: 2122 July  2024 Gofa landslides At least 257 people are killed in two landslides caused by heavy rains that strike two villages in Gofa Zuria, South Ethiopia Regional State.

links.text: -"At least 229 people killed in Ethiopia landslides". Al Jazeera. 2024-07-23. Retrieved 2024-07-23.-
-"Ethiopia mudslide death toll rises to 257". Africanews. 2024-07-25. Retrieved 2024-07-26.-

Data.event_text: 22 July   Fano's Shewan Chief commander Colonel Asegid Mekonnen surrenders to the Ethiopian security forces.

links.text: -"Amhara Fano Shewa Command Chief Surrenders to Government Security Forces". ENA English. Retrieved 2024-07-25.-
-"Ethiopian gov't says a leading Fano leader in Shewa "surrendered"". Borkena Ethiopian News. 2024-07-22. Retrieved 2024-07-25.-

Data.event_text: 27 July   A boat carrying funeral goers sinks along the Tekeze River in Amhara Region, killing 19 of 26 passengers.

links.text: -"19 killed in boat accident in Ethiopia's war-torn Amhara region". Associated Press. Retrieved 2024-07-29.-

Data.event_text: 29 July   The National Bank of Ethiopia (NBE) imposes a flexible exchange rate policy for the Ethiopian birr as part of economic reforms recommended by the International Monetary Fund.

links.text: -"Ethiopia's currency dives by 30% as IMF-backed reforms to stabilize the economy take effect". Associated Press. Retrieved 2024-07-30.-

Data.event_text: 5 August   At least 13 people are killed and 300 others are evacuated following a landslide caused by heavy rains in Kindo Didaye, South Ethiopia.

links.text: -"At least 13 killed and 300 evacuated after deadly landslide in southern Ethiopia". Associated Press. Retrieved 6 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 9 August  Ethiopian Airlines signs an agreement with UAE-based consulting firm Dar to design a new airport in Bishoftu expected to be the largest in Africa.

links.text: -"Ethiopian Airlines signs deal for $6 billion mega airport". France 24. Retrieved 10 August 2024.-

Data.event_text: 19 August  Heaven Awot, a seven-year old girl is revealed to have been brutally raped, mutilated and murdered by her mother's landlord Getnet Baye in Bahir Dar, Amhara Region in .

links.text: -"Heaven Awot: Ethiopia outcry over rape and murder of girl aged 7". BBC. Retrieved 2024-08-19.-

Data.event_text: 25 September  A bus falls into a river in Wolaita, killing 28 people and wounding 19 more.

links.text: -"Ethiopia Bus Accident Kills At Least 28: Officials". Barron's. AFP. Retrieved 2024-09-27.-

Data.event_text: 27 September  a series of earthquakes began with initial epicenter from Afar Region's Awash Fentale and later spread across much of central Ethiopia.

links.text: -"Āwash, Ethiopia". www.sms-tsunami-warning.com. Retrieved 2025-01-03.-

Data.event_text: 7 October  Foreign minister Taye Atskeselassie is elected and inaugurated as President.

links.text: -"Ethiopia's FM elected president, replaces country's first female head of state". Africanews. Retrieved 2024-10-08.-

Data.event_text: 9 October  Ethiopia is elected to a seat at the United Nations Human Rights Council for a three-year term beginning in 2025.

links.text: -"DR Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya elected to Human Rights Council". Africanews. October 10, 2024.-

Data.event_text: 1 December   The Oromo Liberation Army (OLA) and the Government of Oromia Region sign a peace deal in Addis Ababa, after a year of peace talks mediated by Tanzania.

links.text: -"Ministry Hails Peace Deal Between Oromia Regional Gov't, OLA Senior Leader as Critical Step". ENA English. Retrieved 2024-12-08.-
-"Oromia Regional Government, OLA senior leader sign peace agreement". Fana Broadcasting. 2024-12-01. Retrieved 2024-12-08.-

Data.event_text: 7 December   A nationwide electric power blackout occurs due to "system instability".

links.text: -"Nationwide electric blackout hits Ethiopia". Anadolu Ajansi. Retrieved 2024-12-08.-

Data.event_text: 12 December    Ethiopia and Somalia have signed a joint declaration in Ankara, Turkey, to resolve the disputed sovereignty over Somaliland and Ethiopia's access to the Port of the Red Sea.

links.text: -"Ethiopia and Somalia reach deal in Turkey to end Somaliland port feud". www.bbc.com. Retrieved 2025-01-16.-

Data.event_text: 25 December  The Ethiopian National Defense Force closes the country's border with Somalia following heavy fighting in rural areas of Harshin, Fafan Zone, between Ethiopia's Somali regional forces and local clan militias after the killing of a local security chief and his bodyguards. Hundreds of people, including children, flee from their homes.

links.text: -"Ethiopian military closes border with Somaliland as fighting erupts in Somali region". Hiiraan. Retrieved 2024-12-28.-

Data.event_text: 29 December  A truck falls into a river in Bona Zuria, Sidama Region, killing 71 passengers.

links.text: -"At least 71 killed in Ethiopia Road accident". Reuters. 30 December 2024.-
